name: Web Application Development
description: Full web application team: frontend, backend, integration tests, documentation, and coordination. Suitable for any web app project with both client and server components.

tasks.primary: Read all agent handoffs and current backlog.json. Generate 3-5 new tasks for other agents. Prioritize: test failures > security fixes > bugs > features > polish. Write status summary to orchestrator/analysis/producer-status.md.

Review changes made by other agents. Read their handoffs and modified files. Check for type safety issues, pattern violations, missing error handling. Write review report to orchestrator/analysis/review-round-N.md.

Analyze orchestrator health. Read round-decisions.json, session-changelog.md, backlog.json, and recent agent handoffs. Identify stuck agents, blocked tasks, role imbalance, rising failure rates. Write findings to orchestrator/analysis/self-review-round-{N}.md.
Implement cross-cutting features end-to-end: API endpoint → service logic → UI component. Pick one feature from the backlog per round. Run tests before handoff.
Implement server-side features: routes, middleware, services, data models. Follow backlog tasks. Validate inputs at API boundaries. Run tests before handoff.
Implement UI components and frontend logic. Pick one UI task from the backlog per round. Ensure responsive design. Run tests before handoff.
Polish visual design: responsive layout, color consistency, spacing, typography, animations. One element per round. Coordinate with ui-dev on class names.
Write unit tests for changed areas. Focus on boundary conditions, edge cases, regression coverage. Fix broken test assertions caused by other agents' changes. Run full suite to verify no regressions.
Write integration and E2E tests for cross-module workflows. Test API endpoints, authentication flows, and user journeys. Each test is independent with proper setup/teardown.
Keep documentation accurate and up-to-date. Read recent changes from session-changelog.md and update relevant docs. Focus on API docs, setup guides, and architecture docs.
